posts.post_content: Incredible card (and my personal favorite) with limitless combos. Within the simic guild itself, it can instantly make any creature targetable by your graft creatures (such as using [Plaxcaster Frogling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plaxcaster Frogling) to give shroud to a creature thats about to be enchanted) and works especially well with the [Vigean Graftmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vigean Graftmage) to either add a +1/+1 counter to any creature for two mana or steal and use any activated ability in the same turn and continue to use that ability for each two additional mana you spend. Using eventide, Kraj can put a counter on the [Gilder Bairn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilder Bairn) and in the following turns can then add 1 to and double the number of counters on any creature for only three mana and when all is said and done, Kraj is still untapped, able to use any ability that it has stolen. Lastly, I can't even begin to list the number of combos that can occur in two-headed giant.
posts.html:

Using eventide, Kraj can put a counter on the Gilder Bairn and in the following turns can then add 1 to and double the number of counters on any creature for only three mana and when all is said and done, Kraj is still untapped, able to use any ability that it has stolen. Lastly, I can't even begin to list the number of combos that can occur in two-headed giant.

posts.post_content:
Here's a tip for people looking for good abilities to combo with him: Advanced search for Rules Text: ":", Type: "creature", and Colors: Green OR Blue OR Colorless, with exclude unselected colors check.  
  
This'll bring up quite of lot of interesting cards.  
  
Anyway, I personally like to combo this guy with [Sentinel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sentinel) and a regen ability.
posts.html:
Here's a tip for people looking for good abilities to combo with him: Advanced search for Rules Text: ":", Type: "creature", and Colors: Green OR Blue OR Colorless, with exclude unselected colors check.

This'll bring up quite of lot of interesting cards.

Anyway, I personally like to combo this guy with Sentinel and a regen ability.

posts.post_content:
@Frommerman  
  
You need to read those rules again :P  
  
606.2. An activated ability with a loyalty symbol in its cost is a loyalty ability. **Normally, only planeswalkers have loyalty abilities**.  
  
**606.3. A player may activate a loyalty ability of a permanent he or she controls any time he or she has priority and the stack is empty during a main phase of his or her turn, but only if no player has previously activated a loyalty ability of that permanent that turn.**  
  
Highlighted the important parts :)  
  
This is found under the section of Loyalty abilities, see it's not about whether it's a planeswalker or not, the loyalty abilities themselves have the clause that you can't use it more than once per turn, this is stated in the rules, so you'd be able to use the abilities, but only once per turn as it's still a loyalty ability even though it's not a planeswalker using it.
posts.html:
@Frommerman

You need to read those rules again :P

606.2. An activated ability with a loyalty symbol in its cost is a loyalty ability. Normally, only planeswalkers have loyalty abilities.

606.3. A player may activate a loyalty ability of a permanent he or she controls any time he or she has priority and the stack is empty during a main phase of his or her turn, but only if no player has previously activated a loyalty ability of that permanent that turn.

Highlighted the important parts :)

This is found under the section of Loyalty abilities, see it's not about whether it's a planeswalker or not, the loyalty abilities themselves have the clause that you can't use it more than once per turn, this is stated in the rules, so you'd be able to use the abilities, but only once per turn as it's still a loyalty ability even though it's not a planeswalker using it.

Question: I came up with a combo that essentially chews up and spits out the rules of the game. Does this work?  
  
1. Have[Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice), [March of the Machines](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=March of the Machines), and this out.  
2. Play any planeswalker  
3. The planeswalker is an artifact creature while also being a planeswalker  
4. Put a +1/+1 counter on the planeswalker  
5. Theoretically, Experiment Kraj now has all activated abilities of the planeswalker. However, rules pertaining to the use of planeswalker abilities only once per turn only apply to planeswalkers and (I may be wrong) do not cause the planeswalker to tap. Therefore, any + abilities on the planeswalker can be used an infinite amount of times by Experiment Kraj, putting an infinite number of loyalty counters on it.  
6. Use [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor)'s ultimate ability twice, on the same turn, after unsummoning all of their creatures, followed by a [Gideon Jura](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gideon Jura) forced attack, followed by making al... Therefore, any + abilities on the planeswalker can be used an infinite amount of times by Experiment Kraj, putting an infinite number of loyalty counters on it.

posts.post_content: Actually Matt, that doesn't work at all. The Kraj only gets activated abilities. abilities that you want to take "when \_\_ or another ally enters, etc." are triggered. You can only steal activated. So, for allies, your main options would be [harabaz druid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=harabaz druid) or[sea gate loremaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sea gate loremaster). Sorry bud. Lurker, how could you miss something like that? You seem to have some form of grasp on the rules.
posts.html:
Actually Matt, that doesn't work at all. The Kraj only gets activated abilities. abilities that you want to take "when __ or another ally enters, etc." are triggered. You can only steal activated. So, for allies, your main options would be harabaz druid orsea gate loremaster. Sorry bud. Lurker, how could you miss something like that? You seem to have some form of grasp on the rules.

Posted By: PolskiSuzeren (6/20/2010 4:57:43 PM)
Rating:

@matt252007

That wouldn't work, since Kraj gains activated abilities, not triggered abilities. Allies have triggered abilities.

An activated ability has a cost (e.g. tap, GU, etc.), a colon (:), then an effect (Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature, Gain 2 life, etc.)

posts.post_content:
@Sixty3Zero  
  
see rulings of [Dark Impostor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Impostor):  
   
"If an activated ability of a card in exile references the card it's printed on by name, treat Dark Impostor's version of that ability as though it referenced Dark Impostor by name instead. For example, if Marrow Bats (which says "Pay 4 life: Regenerate Marrow Bats") is exiled with Dark Impostor, Dark Impostor has the ability "Pay 4 life: Regenerate Dark Impostor.""  
  
i guess the same would be true for Experiment Kraj
posts.html:
@Sixty3Zero

"If an activated ability of a card in exile references the card it's printed on by name, treat Dark Impostor's version of that ability as though it referenced Dark Impostor by name instead. I was wondering something my friend pointed out.  
  
I use this guy in a EDH deck, him obviously being the commander. Say I want to nab, I dunno, [Viridian Joiner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viridian Joiner)'s ability. The ability Kraj gets from Joiner is "Tap: Add for equal to Viridian Joiner's power." Does the ability still only pertain exclusively to Viridian Joiner? Or does it change to be Kraj's ability? A ton of cards with activated abilities I'd like to steal like [Feral Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Feral Hydra), [Pentavus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pentavus), etc. always say their own names in their activated abilities.  
  
I'm just wondering.
